content:
ToolStripOverflow Class

Definition

Manages the overflow behavior of a ToolStrip.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterface(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class ToolStripOverflow : System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown, IDisposable

WndProc(Message)

Remarks

If there are more overflow items than can be displayed on the form, use the ToolStrip Items Collection Editor to manage this situation.

Constructors

ToolStripOverflow(ToolStripItem)

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripOverflow class derived from a base ToolStripItem.

public ToolStripOverflow (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem parentItem);
parentItem
ToolStripItem

The ToolStripItem from which to derive this ToolStripOverflow instance.

Properties

DisplayedItems

Gets all of the items that are currently being displayed on the ToolStrip.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection DisplayedItems { get; }
Value
ToolStripItemCollection

A ToolStripItemCollection that includes all items on this ToolStrip.

Remarks

Use the DisplayedItems property to get everything the ToolStrip currently displays, including items the user did not add, such as a ToolStripOverflowButton. Use the Items property to get all items on the ToolStrip, including those not being displayed.

Items

Gets all of the items on the ToolStrip, whether they are currently being displayed or not.

public override System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection Items { get; }
Value
ToolStripItemCollection

A ToolStripItemCollection containing all of the items.

Remarks

Use the Items property to get all items on the ToolStrip, including those not being displayed. Use the DisplayedItems property to get only those items that are currently displayed on the ToolStrip.

LayoutEngine

Passes a reference to the cached stem.Windows.Forms.Control.LayoutEngine* returned by the layout engine interface.

public override System.Windows.Forms.Layout.LayoutEngine LayoutEngine { get; }
Value
LayoutEngine

A LayoutEngine that represents the cached layout engine returned by the layout engine interface.

Methods

CreateAccessibilityInstance()

Creates a new accessibility object for the control.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject CreateAccessibilityInstance ();
Returns
AccessibleObject

A new AccessibleObject for the control.

Remarks

If you do not explicitly call the CreateAccessibilityInstance method, it will be called when the AccessibilityObject property is referenced.

Note

To get or set the AccessibilityObject property, you must add a reference to the Accessibility assembly installed with the .NET Framework.

GetPreferredSize(Size)

Retrieves the size of a rectangular area into which a control can be fitted.

public override System.Drawing.Size GetPreferredSize (System.Drawing.Size constrainingSize);
constrainingSize
Size

The custom-sized area for a control.

Returns
Size

An ordered pair of type Size representing the width and height of a rectangle.

OnLayout(LayoutEventArgs)

Raises the Layout event.

protected override void OnLayout (System.Windows.Forms.LayoutEventArgs e);
e
LayoutEventArgs

A LayoutEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnLayout method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

SetDisplayedItems()

Resets the collection of displayed and overflow items after a layout is done.

protected override void SetDisplayedItems ();
